@joelandjacob wrote:

If you read my post, you would know that I tried that. But you would have to add " } else {" and then the “try {” would have to be deleted because they both can’t be in the same thing, and if you delete the “try {” you have to delete the “catchException {”.

item.title: [solved] [remove]
item.dc:creator: @joelandjacob joelandjacob
item.description:
@joelandjacob wrote:

Anyone can you turn my Item command that has restrictedItem spawning to make it unable to spawn in the wilderness. I’ve tried adding “if c.(inWild()) {” but then I have to delete the “try {”.

BTW, it’s a spawn server.

Here’s my command:

		if(playerCommand.startsWith("item")) {
			try {
				String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
					if (args.length == 3)
            {
                int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
                for(int i : restrictedItems) {
                    if(i == newItemID) {
                        c.sendMessage("You do not have the correct @red@privillages@bla@ to spawn that item.");
                        return;
                    }
                }
                int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
                if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0))
                {
                    c.getItems().addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
                } else
                {
                    c.sendMessage("@red@Error:@bla@ Id is out of range.");
                }
            } else
            {
                c.sendMessage("@red@Error:@bla@ Try as ::item_ID_Amount.");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
        }
    }
}

Read full topic
